title: What are the advantages of smartphone cameras over professional cameras? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are only two advantages A. Handy The smartphone camera is ridiculously handy, a device you probably have with you almost everytime. Say you are travelling and you take a pit stop for a minute or two, you can remove your phone and capture some great detail, while on the other hand a dslr use, needs to be planned and isn't as handy to carry along everywhere you go, even though the quality is no match to the dslr, but remember sometimes an okok photo is always better than no photo at all. B. AI Most smartphone cameras are aimed at amature photographers, hence a lot of photography decisions is taken by the camera software generally referred as AI, while it is important to note that not all smartphone cameras do not carry the same AI, for example the pixel 3 has a 12.2 mp single lens camera and captures way more better pictures than the 48mp camera on the Xiaomi note 7 pro, of course a lot depends on the aperture and sensor, but the major difference is the software. It is remarkable how far smart phone cameras have come, that I cannot believe that some photos were captured on a phone and not a dslr. My advice. Photography is an art and the best tool to practise that art is via a dslr where u control everything. But having and using a decent phone camera is also a great tool which cannot be ignored. Use both if u have the liberty to do so. I do.

Smart phone cameras having numbers of advantages over traditional DSLR. Portable (due to immense portability you can capture moments with your mobile phones as it’s always with you unlike DSLR)User friendly interfaceLive view with bigger screen size(these days most of the camera phone are 5” or bigger)Mobile phone seek less attention compare to DSLR(for same reason people who are into street photography prefers mirror less cameras)Better connectivity (can be transmitted very easily using Bluetooth, wiki and etc..)Easy use of filters(these days tons of free photo editing software’s are available in play store and apple)Better quality picture with lesser effort (till some extend better quality pictures can be achieved using mid and top range mobile phones)Mobile phones are cheaper than DSLR(if you think mobile phone are costlier then you are not comparing high end phones with high end DSLR)No maintenance or very limited maintenance required for mobile phone compare to DSLR.Even novice can use it(unlike DSLR where the user needs to acquire considerable knowledge about photography to make best out of it)
